instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
No Backlight.I Have Image. Confirmed.

F7700/L7701/D7701is 8.56V

Backlight Feedback XW7720 is 8.56V.

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> is 2.8V
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> is 2.8V

<SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is 8.5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
Did you check XW7720 continuity?
If OK, probably corroded balls under <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message: How do i check continuity. This is not actually a part on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
Inspecting the bridge under microscope is usually good enough.
But you can check continuity between <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and corresponding <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> ball; scratch a bit the trace near the corner of the chip.
If no good, then run the wire...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ujATnRVNYO93ifpZD7KPi6_swX4C38RH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
Meter in Ohms Mode
Red to <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL>
Black to <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>

I get 1.1 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message: Removed - Cleaned and Re installed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message: Have tried a known good display. its not a display issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
Did you check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM signals?
Also check all return resistors, <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
[QUOTE]
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> is 2.8V
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> is 2.8V
[/QUOTE]

Voltages 
<RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR> - <RESISTOR>R7720</RESISTOR> is 2.3V
<RESISTOR>R7721</RESISTOR>-22 is 0.3V

Diode Mode Readings
 <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22 is .634

Continuity
<RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R7722</RESISTOR> is 1.2 Ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR> - <RESISTOR>R7720</RESISTOR> is 2.3V
<RESISTOR>R7721</RESISTOR>-22 is 0.3V"
You should get almost same value on the six lines.
May have problems with the video connector; or traces from it to <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight Issue
